text: ac disease - Cone-shaped epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand - Downturned corners of mouth - Expressive language delay - Hirsutism - Joint laxity - Long eyelashes - Low posterior hairline - Posteriorly rotated ears - Prominent nose - Smooth philtrum - The Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) has collected information on how often a sign or symptom occurs in a condition. Much of this information comes from Orphanet, a European rare disease database. The frequency of a sign or symptom is usually list
